articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas will release the Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander held in Gaza as a part of efforts to reach a ceasefire agreement and allow humanitarian aid to enter the besieged enclave, a senior Hamas official told Reuters on Sunday.
articles.title: Hamas will release Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander, group says

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: How India threads the diplomatic needle - courting favour with Trump over issues like trade while asserting its own interests in the Kashmir conflict - will depend in large part on domestic politics and could determine the future prospects for conflict in Kashmir.
articles.title: India's diplomatic ambitions tested as Trump pushes for deal on Kashmir

articles.author: Aftab Ahmed, Shivam Patel
articles.description: The military operations chiefs of India and Pakistan will discuss on Monday the next steps for the nuclear-armed neighbours after a ceasefire returns calm to the border, following their fiercest fighting in nearly three decades.
articles.title: Military officials of India, Pakistan to discuss next steps, India says, as ceasefire holds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The release, which could come as early as Monday, could open the way to freeing the rest of the 59 hostages still held in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel says not committed to Hamas ceasefire, only to safe corridor for U.S. hostage release

articles.author: Nicholas Brown
articles.description: Huntar’s plight typifies a crisis facing countless factories in China, where about 80% of toys sold in the U.S. are manufactured. New orders have fallen sharply amid a brutal trade war.
articles.title: This US-owned factory in China made toys for Walmart. Tariffs put it on life support

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: The Trump administration intends to accept a Boeing 747-8 plane as a gift from the Qatari royal family that would then be outfitted to serve as Air Force One, ABC News reported on Sunday, citing unnamed sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Trump set to accept luxury 747 from Qatar to use as Air Force One, ABC News says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dozens of boxes of Nazi material confiscated by Argentinean authorities during World War II were recently rediscovered in the Supreme Court's basement, the court said on Sunday.
articles.title: Argentina's top court finds 80 boxes of Nazi materials in its basement

articles.author: Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Contenders for South Korea's presidency kicked off their campaigns on Monday, vowing to unify a deeply polarised society and spur economic growth while navigating trade negotiations with the United States.
articles.title: South Korea's presidential campaigns kick off, focus on ailing economy

articles.author: Karen Lema, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: Voting was underway in the Philippines on Monday for a normally low-key midterm election that is showcasing an emotionally charged proxy battle between President Ferdinand Marcos Jr and ally-turned-foe, Vice President Sara Duterte.
articles.title: Philippines votes in high-stakes midterms amid Marcos-Duterte showdown

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen will visit Britain this week at the invitation of British lawmakers, a trip that comes as London is trying to improve ties with Beijing and China ramps up efforts to diplomatically isolate the island.
articles.title: Former Taiwan president Tsai to make sensitive visit to Britain this week
